A4.text: the rate of reaction increases by a factor of about 2 to 3 for every 10 Â°C rise in temperature, for common values of activation energy and temperature range.

A5.text: Increasing temperature raises the fraction of molecules with sufficient kinetic energy to overcome this barrier, which explains the strong temperature dependence of reaction rates described by the Arrhenius equation.
